This transformative initiative would pave the way for a healthier future, nurturing not just young bodies but also fostering self-reliance and confidence in their ability to make informed lifestyle choices.

additional_info: Our school aims to revive the annual science fair, which was canceled due to funding cuts. Students benefit greatly from hands-on experiments, but many lack the resources to execute their projects. We would use this grant to purchase lab materials, protective gear, and invite local experts, giving learners a chance to showcase their discoveries.

additional_info: Greetings from our SEN school Harford Manor in Norwich. We are a school with 100 students who have profound learning and developmental disabilities that significantly impact our daily lives. Our parents and staff have formed a charity to support us, The Friends of Harford Manor. They work hard to raise funds to replace old equipment or items we break on accident which the schools limited budget cannot cover. As our charity is run 100% by volunteers every single penny goes to helping improve our quality of life. It is a challenge for SEN school to raise funds as many of our students live in various parts of the county. Any funds raised can could help us build a shelter for the back of classrooms to keep us dry or even for therapeutic resources that help us regulate throughout the school day. We often find ourselves competing with larger schools or academies with larger budgets and more resources, so every penny raised feels like a tiny miracle for us. We could really use funds at the moment to improve our school hall or to buy new swing seats for the secondary play area as the current ones are old, worn out, and ruining our students clothing with dark stains. Any help you could provide would be endlessly grateful for!'

additional_info:
We are a charity based setting that needs as much help as possible. We are a small setting with 4 staff members and 23 children.
Winning this would help set up our sensory area which we want to fill with sensory flowers, different textures of pebbles, slate etc, mirrors and wind chimes. We also have an apple tree that requires a new pot and a sad looking Christmas tree that's looking for a new place to rest her roots.

additional_info: We would love to have the gardening equipment as we do have a small garden but it needs compost and seeds and equipment to allow the children to enjoy growing the vegetables and sharing with their family.  These items would be a great bonus for us as we have limited resources and funding to purchase these in our budget . Our garden patch would be blossoming once again and the children will learn about planting growing and harvesting techniques. Many of these children live in flats or with no access to gardens . In addition there are many parents  who are not aware of the importance of growing . This will increase their knowledge and understanding of the world and help the environment

additional_info: We are a small, rural school of 60 children with limited budgets and limited staff. Our children are very keen to start their own garden and are in the process of building a community pantry to help those around us in need. We would love to get the children outside and in nature and grow some vegetables to help us to stock the pantry and provide fresh food to our families. We also hope to tidy up the village and local care homes with flower displays and planters. This prize would mean the world to our small but ambitious project! Thank you so much for the opportunity.

additional_info: At our school, a significant number of students are dealing with personal and social challenges that affect their well-being and academic success. We are determined to establish a resilience-building program focused on emotional literacy and mental health. Through workshops and counseling sessions, we will foster an environment where students learn to identify and manage their emotions, developing resilience and coping strategies. Our aim is to create a sanctuary where students feel heard, supported, and empowered to face their challenges head-on. With your assistance, we can nurture a generation of emotionally intelligent individuals who value mental health as a cornerstone for lifelong success. This program would be a beacon of hope, offering comfort and strength to the young minds in our care.

additional_info: Our vision is to transform our school into a hub of community service and civic engagement. We dream of creating a comprehensive program that connects students with local organizations, instilling a strong sense of responsibility and empathy. Through volunteering projects and leadership development workshops, we aim to foster a culture of giving and social awareness. Many of our students aspire to make a difference but lack the guidance and resources to do so. With your partnership, we can unlock doors to transformative experiences that shape character and inspire lifelong dedication to community service. This program would cement a legacy of kindness and citizenship, empowering students to become catalysts for positive change in their communities.

additional_info: At Heritage Intermediate, our curriculum lacks opportunities for hands-on local history education. We plan to convert an unused space into a community heritage hub featuring interactive exhibits and archival collections. This hub will inspire civic pride, promote historical awareness, and serve as an engaging educational center for our community.
